loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 53 years of age and single with four children.

Veronika owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Veronika needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Veronika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Veronika's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Arline has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Arline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat has been running an agricultural business for more than 14 years. On his farm Marat is raising three cows, four calves, five sheep, a pig and 20 chickens as well. Also he grows potatoes for sale. He sells dairy products to re-sellers and meat to butchers' shops. Marat’s wife helps him in farming a lot and thus they are able to support their family.    

Marat is 40 years old; he is married and has a small son. Marat is a cook and simultaneously with farming he works at a school as a logistics manager.  
This is Marat’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a $ 2,000 loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings ahead of sowing season.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings ahead of sowing season

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Bernadeth has a tailoring business. She had this business for 40 years.She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase materials for tailoring .Each month, she earns approximately 8000 PHP. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Bernadeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for tailoring

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, de 47 años se caracteriza por ser una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven con 2 de ellos: Katy y Rosa en su casa propia, ubicada en el Barrio Esperanza. Es la primera vez que trabaja con su asociación de la que fue invitada para progresar como los demás integrantes, se siente muy bien pues está convencida de poder triunfar con la ayuda de todos. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la siembra de papa, maíz y todo tipo de hortalizas, en terrenos agrícolas propios y alquilados. Aprovecha las largas jornadas en el campo para cuidar de sus animales entre vacas, toros, cerdos, “quien  sabe trabajar, dedica todo el día al cuidado de sus sembríos”, comenta. Al mismo tiempo que menciona que aprovecha a los toros para hacer el arado de la tierra, el cual le ayuda su esposo. Asimismo cuenta que los fines de semana, aprovecha para vender comida, tiene muchos años cocinando y los comensales que visitan su puesto, consumen con frecuencia, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Juliana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir entre sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Juliana, 47, characterizes herself as a happy woman. She lives with Antonio, her husband of 30 years. They have 5 children but only two of them, Katy and Rosa, live with them. They live in their own home located in Barrio Esperanza. This is her first time working with this group, which she was invited to join so that she could get ahead like the other members. She feels very good because she is convinced she will be able to succeed with the help of all.

Juliana’s principal income derives from cultivating potatoes, corn and all kinds of vegetables on both rented and owned agricultural land. She takes advantage of long workdays in the country to tend to her animals, which include cows, bulls and pigs. She notes that “She who knows how to work, spends the whole day caring for her fields.” At the same time she mentions that she makes good use of the bulls in ploughing the ground, which helps her husband. Similarly, she says that on weekends she profits by selling food and has been cooking for many years. Diners frequently visit her stand to eat and in this way she earns extra money.

Juliana belongs to the Huaribamba Communal  Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy since she hopes to receive a loan in order to continue with her objectives. As well, she promises to be punctual in her payments. She is a responsible and caring person. Upon receiving your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to apply to her fields of potatoes and corn.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 36 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Juvenal, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio La Esperanza. La siembra de diversos productos agrícolas es su especialidad, cuenta que durante todo este tiempo dedicándose a la agricultura, sembró toda variedad de papa, de diversos colores y tamaños, además de hortalizas, verdura y cereales. Cuenta con sus propios terrenos agrícolas las cuales le brindan muchas ganancias, pues cuida con demasiado cuidado del proceso de crecimiento. Pero como buena proveedora, también cría animales entre cerdos y ovejas, las cuales alimenta para venderlos, solo si tiene alguna necesidad, pero si no, los utiliza para el consumo de su esposo e hijos. Ahora desea mejorar sus cultivos e incrementar los ingresos ya que sus hijos son pequeños y necesitaran educación, “ahí gastaré mucho dinero”, afirma. Pero eso no es un inconveniente, ya que ella luchará por brindarle lo mejor que pueda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Marina de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Marina, 36 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Juvenal, her husband. Together they have 7 children whom they care for in their own house located in the barrio of La Esperanza (Hope). To plant diverse agricultural products is her specialty. Marina tells us that since she has been a farmer, she has sown every type of potato, of diverse colors and sizes, in addition to vegetables, greens, and cereals. She has her own agricultural lands which have given her a lot of earnings, since she takes good care of her crops as they grow. But like a good provider, she also raises animals, especially pigs and sheep, which she fattens in order to sell, but only when she has the need. If not, she uses them to feed her husband and children.

Now Marina wants to improve her crops and increase income, since her children are still little and need an education. “On that I'll spend a lot of money,” Marina says. And this is no inconvenience, because she is willing to struggle to offer them the best she can.

Marina belongs to the “Huaribamba” solidarity group and this is their 7th loan cycle through MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy. She hopes to obtain this loan to continue on towards her objectives. As always, she promises to make her payments punctually. Marina is a responsible and dependable person. Upon receiving her loan, she will use the requested money to purchase natural fertilizers to spread on her next plantings of potatoes.

loans.use: buy natural fertilizers for her next potato crop.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Agripino, su esposo desde hace 29 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, los cuales ya se casaron. Ahora ellos viven juntos en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. Desde hace 7 años consecutivos, viene vendiendo miel de abeja, yogurt y queso a la capital del país, donde no existen estos productos o cuestan mucho dinero. Durante todo este tiempo obtuvo buenos compradores quienes, ya la conocen y son sus clientes asiduos. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa, zanahoria, alverja y alfalfa, en sus grandes terrenos de cultivo, siembra en cantidad, pues es su principal ingreso económico. Además tiene 29 años de experiencia en la agricultura. Su éxito para durar todo este tiempo se centra en la distribución, pues sus hijos le apoyan en eso, comercializando sus alimentos en la capital del país, donde cuentan más dinero estos productos, por ser costa. Ahora desea mejorar sus cultivos y poder ahorrar todo lo que pueda, con la ayuda de su esposo. Ya que muy pronto cosechará zanahoria y maíz. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya” y este es el décimo séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez más, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Catalina, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus cultivos de papa y zanahoria que tiene sembrado.
texts.en:
Catalina, age 52, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Agripino, her husband of 29 years. They have four children, all of whom are already married.
Catalina and Agripino now live together in the home of Agripino's parents, located in the town of Sicaya. Catalina has been selling honey, yoghourt, and cheese for seven years in the capital city; these products are either unavailable there or cost a lot of money. Over time, Catalina has obtained good, loyal  customers who know her well. Catalina also sows potato, carrots, peas, and alfalfa on her extensive lands. She plants a lot, as this is her main source of income. She has 29 years of experience in agriculture. The secret to her success over all this time is based in distribution: her children help her by selling her produce in the capital city, where they sell for a higher price. Catalina now wants to improve her crops and to be able to save as much money as possible with her husband's help. She will be harvesting carrots and corn very soon. She belongs to the "Sicaya" communal bank, and this is her 17th loan with MFP. She is very happy, because during all this time she has been able to make a lot of money--all thanks to our economic support. She promises once more to repay her quotas. She enjoys being part of the association; all of the members are united and hard-working. Upon receiving your support, Catalina will invest in the purchase of natural fertilizers in order to improve her carrot and potato crops which she has already planted.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia de 31 años convive con Santos, el padre de su hijo Samir de 8 años y del pequeño que viene en camino. Esta familia vive unida en una casa alquilada ubicada en el anexo de Yanama, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Olivia cuenta que, desde que tenía 15 años ya apoyaba a sus padres en el trabajo del campo. De esta manera aprendió sobre lo cansado y gratificante que son las cosechas. Al lado de Santos empezaron a producir papas en distintas variedades, habas y arvejas.
“Siembro papa Yungay, Andina, Perricholi y Única (variedades), porque así vendo mejor”, dice. Confiesa que el cultivo de este tubérculo es muy cansado por eso contrata jornaleros a quienes paga al día por sus servicios.
A la vez, se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes que instaló en la casa donde vive. Por ahora prefiere cuidar su negocio por el su estado ya que lleva 8 meses de embarazo. Posteriormente se reincorporará al trabajo de campo porque extraña llevar sus pocas ovejas a pastar mientras realiza la limpieza de sus cultivos. Sus objetivos son claros. Aumentar su producción para ahorrar más e implementar su bodega con mayor mercadería. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Por recomendación de vecinos se animó en ser parte de un grupo sólido y responsable: “Los Manantiales de Yanama”. De obtener el crédito podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar los cultivos de papas, que cosechará en mayo.
texts.en:
Olivia, 31, lives with Santos, the father of her 8 year old son, Samir, and the little one that’s on the way.  This united family lives in a rented house located in Yanama Annex, Palca-Tarma District.  Olivia relates that since the age of 15 she started helping her parents with the field work.  This is how she learned both how exhausting and gratifying harvests can be.  Alongside Santos she began to produce various varieties of potatoes, broad beans and peas.

“I always plant Yungay, Andina, Perricholi and Única (varieties) potatoes because they sell best,” she says.  She confesses that farming this tuber is very tiring which is why she hires day laborers that she pays a daily wage for their services.

At the same time she also tends to the small grocery store she set up in the house she lives in.  For now, she prefers to tend to the store because she’s in her 8th month of pregnancy.  Later on she will retake field work because she misses taking her few sheep out to pasture while weeding her crops.  Her objectives are clear: to increase production to save more and to stock her store with more merchandise.

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  It was thanks to recommendations from her neighbors that she ventured to become part of this solid, responsible group, “Los Manantiales de Yanama.”  If she were to obtain the loan, she will buy sacks of organic manure to fertilize her potato crops that she’ll harvest in May.

loans.use: to buy sacks or organic manure.

loans.name: Aldo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Aldo tiene 34 años y es viudo  tiene  dos  hijos que son pequeño, el se dedica a fabricación y venta de calzados hace ya bastante tiempo su taller se encuentra en la zona de Cristo Rey,  Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Aldo utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de materia prima, materiales y herramientas  para la fabricación de calzados, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de material para pedido de botas. Aldo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son expandir su mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar capital. Se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Aldo is 34, a widower, and has two small children.  For some time he has been making and selling shoes, and maintains a workshop in the area of Cristo Rey,  This is Aldo's second loan, which he plans to use to buy basic materials, supplies and tools to make shoes.  He seeks this loan to buy material to make boots. Aldo faces challenges such as expanding his business and increase his working capital.  He is happy and grateful for the support given to him.

loans.use: to buy basic materials, supplies and tools to make shoes

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa en una de las calles mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba, sale a su puesto muy temprano ya que el flujo de clientes es mayor durante las mañanas en especial los días de feria (miércoles y sábado),  tiene esposo el no vive con ella, cabe recalcar que es rentista y no tiene hijos por los que tenga que velar directamente,  el motivo principal es tener mayor mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en: Martha sells clothing in one of the busiest streets in the city of Cochabamba.  She starts work very early as customer traffic is heaviest in the morning hours, especially on market days (Wednesdays and Saturdays).  She is married but lives apart from her husband, and she does not have children who she supports directly.  She seeks this loan to have more merchandise to sell at the holidays, and will use the credit buy seasonal clothing for re-sale.  She is very hardworking and very pleased with the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has five children. 

Emelda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for five years.  She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to stock and sell.

Emelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been working in mixed farming for 14 years in addition to working as a civil servant.  Though currently retired, he earns a pension that supplements his farming income.  He is married and has five adult children.

Joseph has made a second loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to buy water pipes.  He says he will use the pipes to irrigate his farm and to improve his animal feed, which he grows and sells to other farmers.  He says that insufficient rain remains a challenge to farming.

He will use the income to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is aged 46 and married with five children all being of primary school-going ages. His farm produces coffee, milk, eggs and maize.

He has requested a third loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter (to cut fodder) for his dairy farm. He hopes better feeding enabled by the availability of a chuff cutter will help him double his production. He is focusing on owning five dairy cows in the next five years.

He states that poor climatic conditions and poorly organized markets for farming produce are still limitations to farmers.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter to cut fodder

loans.name: Nuualuga

texts.en:
Nuualuga is 74 years old, a widow with seven children.

Nuualuga owns & operates a business venture selling pancakes.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Nuualuga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Nuualuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Nuualuga's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is 36 years old and married to Peter. Together, they have four children between the ages of one and four years old. She has been in the tailoring business for five years and generates a monthly income of KES 5,000. She will be using this loan to buy a solar kit that provides light for her home. Her dream is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To provide light in the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: grow her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar  is 22 years old, a single man who lives in Aden, Yemen. His educational background is a Bachelor's degree.  He has been operating an electrical materials store for two years. He started his business by renting a small shop. But thanks to the good way he’s managed his income from the business, he was able to obtain financing and expanded his business. He has employed two persons who help him to work well and get more clients. The advantage of his business is that it earns good profits but he also has a lot of competition and his sales have decreased recently.

So, Omar is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. This loan will be used to buy lamps, wires and fans to stock his store. His goal is to make his business grow, turning it into a big store which will increase his income, as well as buying a car and getting married.

loans.use: to buy lamps, wires and fans for his business

loans.name: Blsm Group

texts.en:
This group called BLSM consists of four members who are all females: Saba, Fathia, Jihan and Fatima. All of them are friends from Taiz, Yemen. They primarily work together in small businesses like selling clothes. The group took a loan of 150,000 YER.

Saba is a 23-year-old married woman (she is the woman who is standing up in the center of the photo). She has been running her business for three years. To meet the needs of her family, she started selling clothes in a market. She has already benefited from the first loan that she requested from AMB. She has successfully repaid her loan and has saved a considerable amount.

Now she requested a second youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She is going to reinforce her supply by buying more clothing products such as shirts, pants and scarves to increase the profit from her business. 

In the future, Saba plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as shirts, pants and scarves  for her business .

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
This is Emiliana, 66, a resident of Bacoor Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent and mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emiliana oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emiliana dreams that her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is thirty-one years of age and married with five children.

Salome owns and operates a business venture, driving a taxi.  She has a year of experience in this business. Salome needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase new tires and pay the vehicle registration fee. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Salome joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Salome's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay the vehicle registration fee.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is thirty-seven years old and lives in Punta, Liloy. She is married with three children.

Riza works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Riza has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Riza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Fogalele

texts.en:
Fogalele is forty-eight years old and married with five children.

Fogalele owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Fogalele needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2012, Fogalele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fogalele's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, fifty-seven, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Manuel and a mother to one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Milagros hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Domonic is thirty-six years old, married, with one child. He runs a bookshop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and employs two people. To earn extra income he does farming. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy pens, photocopy papers and exercise books to sell.

loans.use: To buy pens, photocopy papers and exercise books to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 47 años y es Soltera se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de  Warnes. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Rosario utilizara este préstamo de para Capital de Trabajo (compra de mesas, sillas, garrafas y capital de inversión)  para su negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer su negocio. Rosario o enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios en  incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con el tiempo la Sra. Rosario desea tener su propio restaurante, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and single. She sells meals at her sales stall located in the Warnes zone. This loan is her first through this institution. 

Rosario will use this loan to purchase tables, chairs, large glasses, and other investments in her business. She is soliciting the loan to make her business grow. Rosario confronts challenges to her business in the form of competition and will utilize the loan amount to increase her working capital. 

In time, Rosario hopes to have her own restaurant. She feels very grateful for this offer of help.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, and large glasses for the stall where she sell meals.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a builder and he repairs offices and houses by private order. He has been engaged in this business for more than eight years. Armen’s occupation is the only source of his family’s income as his wife is housewife, his son is a pupil and his daughter is a third-year student at the Armenian State Linguistic University of the English language department. 

Armen is asking for a 200,000 AMD loan to pay for his daughter’s education for her second semester. Armen is 42 years old and he lives in Yerevan. He is a second-cycle client of Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's education

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29-year-old man from Homabay and is married to Mary.  They have three children between the ages of one and three years old.

John operates a carpentry business and has been doing this for the last 10 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy timber, nails, and glue. His profits will be used to educate his children.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails, and glue.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is 38 years old, married, and has five children.

Faaiuga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Faaiuga needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2011, Faaiuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faaiuga's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 30 years old. He is married to Milkah and together they have one child. Timothy is a farmer and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is Timothy's first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and herbicides and also to pay for labor.

Timothy hopes to expand his business and purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and herbicides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
This is Jessica, thirty-five, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, thirty-nine, who is a helper. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are studying as high school students. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and her business.  

Jessica maintains a piggery business. She buys piglets and raises them for four months before selling them in the market. The cost of live pork per kilo is PHP 130. Each pig, if raised and fed well, will weigh about 90-94 kilos. She can have PHP 5,000 as net income from every pig that she sells. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan as an additional capital for the purchase of more piglets. More hogs to raise means more income and profit. She saves her earnings for the educational needs of her children. 

Jessica dreams that all her children will be able to finish studies and have a good life. She hopes to renovate her house and that her pigs won’t get sick so that her business will maintain a good income. She wants stability in her business. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to have time for God after a long week of work.    

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional pigs and feed needed in her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-eight years old. She is married, and a mother of two school-going children. She has been selling assorted fruits in Kilifi for the last five years and she is doing great. 

This is her third business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes, apples and pineapples to resell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and add more stock to her business. She hopes to excel in the business and live a prosperous life through loans from KADET.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, mangoes, apples and pineapples.

loans.name: La Seriedad Group

texts.es:
Doña Elvia, es miembro del Banco Comunal La Seriedad, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos (3 mujeres y 4 varones), su Esposo se dedica a la ganadería y trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos varones, su meta es ver a sus  hijos profesionales y trabajando. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 15 años. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de dos fardos de ropa, sobretodo estilos que estén de moda, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas llamando la atención de más personas. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más mercadería y así podrá aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar. Una de sus dificultades es que en algunas ocasiones sus clientes le quedan debiendo. Su  mayor sueño es ahorrar para tener su propio local, ya que actualmente realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante y tiene que lidiar con los cambios del clima. Tiene 15 ciclos de recibir el apoyo FAMA a través de los prestamos que ha obtenido y es una clienta que ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Elvia is a member of 'La Seriedad' community bank.  She is 50 years old, married, and has seven children (three daughters and four sons).  Her husband raises livestock and works together with their sons.  Elvia's goal is to see her children become professionals and see them working.

Elvia has been selling new and used clothing for 15 years.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying two bundles of clothing, especially fashionable styles.  This will enable her to increase her sales, attracting more people's attention.  With the support of the loan, she will have more merchandise and will therefore be able to increase her profits and improve her household finances.  One of the difficulties she faces is that sometimes her customers don't pay.  Her biggest dream is to save up so that she can buy her own sales premises because she currently makes her sales on foot and she has to deal with changes in the weather.  Elvia has been receiving support from FAMA for 15 loan cycles.  She is a client who has always made her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Jesus Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es miembro  del Grupo Jesus, se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de tortillas, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería, ellos residen en la Colonia Bella Oriente, en el municipio de Juticalpa. Doña Lucia anteriormente vivía en el Barrio de Jesús donde inicio haciendo tortillas desde niña cuando vivía con su madre, actualmente se dedica al mismo negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas, donde comienza a las 5 a.m hasta las 5 p.m, siendo que doña Lucia tiene que trasladarse desde la Colonia Bella Oriente hasta su lugar de trabajo que es en el Barrio de Jesús,en la misma ciudad, también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon. 

Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela y su desventaja es que el fogón donde hace las tortillas esta expuesto al sol y al agua por no tener una caceta para cubrirlo y que tiene que viajar todos los días en la madrugada desde su casa hasta su lugar de trabajo. El préstamo que doña Lucia esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo  en la compra de maseca y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo cambiaria su nivel de vida porque con las ganancias que reciba podrá comprar una estufa industrial y hacer una caceta para mejorar su lugar de trabajo. Una de sus metas es tener un local bien establecido para su tortillera para atender mejor sus clientes. Ha tenido 14 ciclos con FAMA y los ha cancelado puntualmente ya que con las ganancias de los préstamos obtenidos pudo construir su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Jesus Solidarity Group.  She works making and selling tortillas.  She is 49 years old and married, and has seven children.  Her husband works in agriculture and in building.  They live in Colonia Bella Oriente in the town of Juticalpa.  Previously she lived in Barrio de Jesús, where she began making tortillas when she was a little girl when she lived with her mother.

Currently she works in the same business of making and selling tortillas, beginning at 5 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has to travel from Colonia Bella Oriente to Barrio de Jesús, in the same city.  She also works selling Avon products.

Her advantage is that she has very good customers.  Her disadvantage is that the stove where she makes tortillas is exposed to the sun and the water because she does not have a stand to cover it.  Also, she has to travel every day at dawn from her house to her workplace.

Lucia needs the loan she is requesting to invest in buying Maseca [a brand of instant corn masa flour] and firewood.  With the help of this loan she would change her standard of living because with the profits she makes she will be able to buy an industrial stove and make a stand to improve her workplace.

One of her goals is to have a well-established place for her tortilla business to better serve her customers.  She has had 14 loan cycles with FAMA and she has paid them back punctually.  With the profits from the loans given, she was able to build her little house.

loans.use: to buy Maseca [a brand of corn flour] and firewood.

loans.name: Ruben Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén  tiene 39 años y es soltero no tiene hijos, el tiene la actividad de  Coordinador - capacitador su oficina se encuentra en la zona central, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Rubén utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de mamparas para división de ambientes para aulas por actividad, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es para infraestructura de ambientes de capacitación,  Rubén enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar sus instalaciones. y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar capital de trabajo. Su deseo es con el tiempo aumentar cursos de capacitación.
texts.en: Ruben is 39; he is single and does not have children. His occupation is training coordinator, and his office can be found in central La Paz. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Ruben will use this loan to buy partitions to divide rooms into classrooms for different activities. His reason for requesting this loan is for the infrastructure of the training rooms. The challenge Ruben faces in his business is improving his facilities, and he will use the profits to increase his working capital. His wish is to increase over time the number of training courses offered.

loans.use: to buy partitions for the division of classrooms.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in Murang’a, Central Kenya. He is 65 years old and has been in farming for over 30 years. His farm currently produces pigs, maize, bananas, and milk, which are all sold to the locals and help him meet his family's needs. David has two children, ages 11 and 15.

David has requested his first loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says his goal is to own at least ten dairy cows in five years. He adds that the loan will improve his family's living standards and his farming practice.  He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's financial services.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Paepaeloa

texts.en:
Paepaeloa is forty-seven years of age and married with six children.

Paepaeloa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Paepaeloa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Paepaeloa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Paepaeloa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is single. Dioscora is fifty-nine years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Dioscora sells sacks of rice to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
This is Carla, thirty-six, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Fred, a driver, and is a mother of three children, one in high school and two in elementary. While attending to her family needs, she also kept herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.

Carla owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She is also into a piggery business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 Philippine Peso in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loans. She will be using the loan to buy more grocery items. The more items displayed at the store the better. It will help her to save more money for any possible expenditure ahead. 

Carla hopes that her variety store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that it will continue to grow and sustain the needs of her family. She wishes that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Sharing the word of God completes her. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested an PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Faauu

texts.en:
Faau is a mother of two and she's single.

Faauu is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faauu needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Faauu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faauu's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Aloaalii

texts.en:
Aloaalii is 19 years of age, married, and has one child.

Aloaalii owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Aloaalii needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Aloaalii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Aloaalii's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is married and has one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cherryl sells cosmetic products to earn a living and has had this business for twelve years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

Cherryl is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Felila

texts.en:
Felila is 45 years of age and married with six children.

Felila owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Felila needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Felila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Felila's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is engaged in animal breeding. On his farm he rears cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Artem uses part of the agricultural products that he produces, such as milk, meat and eggs, for his family’s needs and the other part he sells to a butcher’s shop and milk Collection Company. 

Artem is twenty-eight years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. He lives with his brother’s family and his sister-in-law helps him in farming. After serving in army Artem has started to run his animal-breeding business. 

Artem is asking for a $ 1,800 loan to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, forty-six, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, a government employee, and is the mother of two children. The eldest is in college and youngest in high school. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping his husband in sustaining daily expenses.

Mary Grace owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also into selling hollow blocks (the ones that are used in building houses) as an additional source of income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items and stock. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her earnings would be a big help for the education of her children and expenditures ahead.    

Mary Grace dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow and help them pay daily expenses. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it makes her a better person and strengthens her faith in Christ.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is forty-seven years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Raquel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is thirty-eight years old, married, with three children. He sells household goods to earn a living. He has been in the business for fourteen years and employs one person. To earn extra income he transports goods with his hand cart. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic basins, padlocks, cups and plates to sell.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins, padlocks, cups and plates to sell.

loans.name: Lisset Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Lisset es una mujer que tiene un pequeño de 2 años, su principal motivo de vida. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, lo que le permite generar los ingresos que necesita junto a su esposo que brinda el servicio de transporte público. Esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar que con el transcurso de los años ha logrado un gran progreso y se ha desarrolla económicamente.

Lisset vende aproximadamente 5 horas al día, tiempo en el que visita a sus amistades y vecinos. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo se puede concretar las ventas y esto le permite mejorar constantemente su calidad de vida, como ingreso adicional se dedica  a la venta de ropa y con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá comprar ropa para el colegio, tales como uniformes, blusas, medias, entre otros. 

Lisset se ha trazado como meta en algunos meses tener una tienda establecida y con la mejora de sus ingresos podrá cumplir su gran sueño “Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Lisset is a woman with a small child aged 2, her principal motive for living. At present, she sells beauty products, which allows her to generate the income she needs, together with her husband's earnings in public transportation. This small family lives in the city of Ica, Peru, a location that over the years, has made great progress and developed economically.

Lisset spends approximately 5 hours a day soliciting sales, visiting her friends and neighbors. She understands that with effort, she can make sales and this will permit her to improve her quality of life constantly. With the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to purchase school clothes, such as uniforms, blouses, and socks, among other items, to sell.

Lisset has laid out plans for the next few months, hoping to have an established store. And with her improved income, she hopes to fulfill her grand dream: “To have her own house.”

loans.use: buy school clothes to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 47 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has seven children.

Perla works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for fifteen years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Perla has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and pay for manual labour on her farm.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising and firewood sales. Editha is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more purified drinking water to sell to customers.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more purified drinking water to sell to customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with one child. Cecilia is lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cecilia owns a general store to earn a living and had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elominada

texts.en:
Elominada is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old. Elominada is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Elominada owns and operates a business venture, manufacturing and selling nipa huts to local businesses and community members. (Nipa huts are houses constructed of bamboo with a thatched roof made from the leaves of the nipa palm.) She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Elominada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Elominada is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture nipa huts for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture nipa huts for sale.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a thirty-eight-year-old lady from Homabay. She is married to Lucas and they have eight children aged between five and nineteen.

Peres operates a hotel business and has been doing this for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more foodstuffs like cooking oil and maize flour. 

She will use her profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to own a big hotel

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is fifty-three years old and two of her children are in school.

Clarita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en:
Tausala is forty-seven years of age and married with seven children

Tgausala owns and operates a business venture, selling pork buns. She has seven years of experience in this business. Tausala needs a loan of WST $3050 to purchase meat such as chicken, soy sauce, a deep frying pan, flour and cooking oil. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Tausala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tausala's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase meat such as chicken, soy sauce, a deep frying pan, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is fifty-one years old, married, and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Isabel requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for fifteen years now, and has borrowed twenty-two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Isabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gaudiosa is fifty-two years old and has one child who is in school.

Gaudiosa has a making and selling lumber business in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her lumber business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her lumber business.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio works hard to support he family. He is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Eusebio requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment to make repairs.

Eusebio has been in this business for three years.

He would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment to make repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Flordelicita

texts.en:
Flordelicita works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a shoe-making business in the Philippines.

Flordelicita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shoe making business.

She has been in this business for eighteen years.

Flordelicita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josefina is fifty years old and one of her children is in school.

Josefina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

She has been in this business for thirty years. Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sefiliga

texts.en:
Sefiliga is twenty-eight years of age and single with four children.

Sefiliga owns and operates a business venture, driving a taxi. She has two years of experience in this business. Sefiliga needs a loan of WST $1,500 to service her taxi. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Sefiliga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sefiliga's second loan loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to service her taxi.

loans.name: Ludelita

texts.en:
Ludelita is thirty-eight years old and married with four children.

Ludelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ludelita has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from e-loading.

Ludelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene, forty, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a married to Rogel, a salesman, and is the mother of one child. Together with her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mylene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mylene dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-six years old. He is married to Roxana. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow.

He hopes to diversify his farming to dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en: This time, for her fifth loan cycle, Gigina is  borrowing PHP 18,000 to fund her fishing and fish vending business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva and continues to provide Gigina and her family with income which increases and improves their living condition.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Maky

texts.fr:
Monsieur  MAKY est âgé de 21 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença  très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père qui menait plusieurs activités (courtier, vente d’articles divers, etc.). Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, MAKY, lui opta pour l’achat vente d’essence et huile pour moteur. Il   mène cette activité depuis 8 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, il sollicite ce prêt. Il  est à son 1er prêt individuel  et   compte l’utiliser pour acheter,  220 litres d’essence. Il  s’approvisionne sur place  et revend au comptant  à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt il   envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus tels les activités de vente d’articles de quincailleries, activité dans laquelle il ambitionne s’installer en ouvrant une boutique de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
Mr. MAKY is a 21-year-old single man without children. He lives in a traditional family in the district of Hamdallaye, in Ségou.

Because social reasons kept him from attending school, he started early on to earn a living alongside his father who was practicing several activities (broker, retailer of miscellaneous merchandise, etc.). After many years of training, MAKY decided to sell gas and motor oil. Eight years later, he has acquired valuable experience and a large customer base.

He is now seeking a loan to increase his working capital and bolster his revenue. This is his first individual loan, and he will use it to purchase 220 litres of gas. He buys his stock locally and sells for cash to a mixt clientele. 

With the help of this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 45,000CFAF, which will allow him to repay the loan and run other income-generating activities such as selling hardware items. His goal for the future is to open a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy gas for resale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 53 años de edad que tiene a un pequeño de 6 años por el que da todo de sí diariamente. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Nazca, Perú, atrayente de gran cantidad de turistas por las reconocidas “Lineas de Nazca”, de las cuales se desconoce el origen de su procedencia.

Él se dedica a la venta de hora aproximadamente 10 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende a una considerable cantidad de clientes, sabe que su negocio está teniendo éxito por el esfuerzo y la dedicación que le pone diariamente.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, desea poder realizar la compra de ropa para niños que se encuentran en etapa escolar, tales como blusas, camisas, pantalones, medias, entre otros. Santos sabe que con este apoyo podrá captar a un mayor número de clientes debido a que es en estos meses en donde los padres de familia tienen mucho interés en la compra de este tipo de prendas debido a que sus pequeños ingresan a una nueva etapa escolar. Él desea incrementar sus ingresos para así ampliar su negocio y así juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Santos is a 53-year-old man who has a small child, age 6. He gives his all every day for the sake of his child. He currently lives in Nazca, Peru. This region draws a large number of tourists because of the famous Nazca Lines, whose origin is unknown.
Santos works as a salesman approximately ten hours per day. During this time, he serves a considerable number of clients. He knows that his business is successful because of his daily hard work and dedication.
With the help of the Kiva lenders, he wants to purchase clothing for school-aged children such as: blouses, shirts, pants, socks, and other items. Santos knows that this support will allow him to capture a larger amount of customers. This is the season in which fathers are greatly interested in buying all sorts of garments because their children are starting school. Santos wants to increase his income in order to expand his business and then put together enough money to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy school clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the area where she washes cars.

loans.name: Loteuaina

texts.en:
Loteuaina is thirty-two years of age and married with four children.

Loteuaina works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Loteuaina needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Loteuaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Loteuaina's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is a thirty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Bonaface and they have four children aged between eight and sixteen.

Truphosa is a fruit juice vendor and has been doing this for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy a variety of fruits like mangoes, passion fruit and watermelons for fruit juice production. 

Her anticipated profits will be used to expand her business and educate the children. Her dream is to own a fruit juice parlor.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits like mangoes, passion fruit and watermelons.

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en:
Mativa is fifty-six years of age and married with four children.

Mativa works in her business, planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Mativa needs a loan of WST $2,700 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Mativa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mativa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Michelle is twenty-seven years old and her three children are in school.

Michelle has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and repair her tricycle.

Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and repair her tricycle.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Tita is a married woman with three children. Her youngest child is twenty-one years old and still goes to school. Her husband works as a farmer.

Tita is in the business of raising pigs. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Tita also supports her husband in selling his harvest at the market. Tita works hard to sustain her family and send her child to college. She plans to use her loan to purchase pigs, feeds and fertilizers. Tita hopes for her business to be stable.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rokayatou Fall

texts.fr:
ROKAYATOU est âgée de 35 ans, mariée  et mère de 4  enfants. Elle   vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Pelengana Sud  de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales car issue d’une famille conservatrices des valeurs ancestrales. Elle commença à s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente d’habits appris auprès de sa mère  qui vendait des habits en cotonnade.
Nantie de plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle  commença à évoluer  seule en menant les activités de commerce de Bazin car ce dernier est très prisé sur le marché. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 2 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle   est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 2 pièces de bazins riches. Elle  s’approvisionne à Bamako. ROKAYATOU vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte très généralement elle fait de l’exportation surtout au Sénégal. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 400 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Rokayatou is 35 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in a close family in the Pelengana neighborhood of Ségou. She did not go to school for social reasons: she comes from a family that upholds ancestral values. 

Rokayatou became interested in income-producing activities, especially selling clothes, as she learnt from her mother, who sold cotton clothes. After several years of apprenticeship, she began to work on her own by selling damask fabric, which is highly sought after. She has been doing this for two years and so she has experience, and she has many customers. 

With the goal of increasing her business capital and making more profit, she is asking for a loan. This is her first individual loan which she plans to use to buy to pieces of rich damask cloth. Rokayatou obtains her supplies in Bamako. She sells on a cash basis to a variety of different customers, she also exports to Senegal. With the loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 400,000 CFA francs. This will allow her to repay the loan and take up other income-producing activities.

loans.use: to buy pieces of damask fabric.

loans.name: Maripa

texts.ru:
Марипе 55 лет. Марипа 32 года проработала учителем кыргызского языка и литературы, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Марипа занимается животноводством.  Начатое еще в период Советского Союза с 30,000 сом хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в день. На данный момент в хозяйстве Марипы 3 дойные коровы, 20 голов овец, 9 голов коз и 3 лошади.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Марипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Maripa is 55 years old. She has worked as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher for 32 years and is now retired. As a source of income for the family Maripa does animal husbandry. The business she started during the Soviet Union times with 30,000 som (KGS) now brings her around 10,000 KGS a day. At this time Maripa's business has three milk cows, twenty sheep, nine goats and three horses.

Maripa has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KGS to buy calves for fattening and resale with the purpose to grow her business. She plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Elvis Alberto

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre de  40 años de edad que junto a su esposa crían a su pequeño de 14 años. Actualmente ellos tienen una  bodega, en donde su esposa se dedica a esta todo el día, Elvis trabaja como chofer y también apoya a su esposa en la bodega ya que les está resultando muy rentable. 

Su bodega atiende un promedio 10 horas, en donde atienden aproximadamente a 36 clientes que viven por la zona. Elvis es consciente de que las personas prefieren asistir a su pequeña tienda porque siempre le brinda un tanto amable a cada uno de sus clientes y esto ha fortalecido el vínculo comercial.

Elvis desea poder realizar algunas reparaciones a su auto y desde luego comprar algunos productos para la bodega, tales como abarrotes, leche, bebidas, entre otros. Su sueño es poder generar mejores ingresos con su vehículo y empezar a ahorra para poder hacer que su bodega se vuelva más conocida, lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos y así poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis is a 40-year-old man who is raising a fourteen-year-old child with his wife. They run a grocery store, and his wife works there all day. Elvis works as a driver and also helps his wife in the grocery store, which is proving quite profitable.
The store is open an average of ten hours per day, and they will generally see about 36 local customers. Elvis knows that people prefer to go to his little store because they always offer very good service to each and every customer. This has strengthened their business.
Elvis wants to be able to make some repairs to his car and buy some products for their grocery store, such as groceries, milk, drinks, and other items. His dream is to be able to generate a better income with his vehicle and to start to save up. He hopes to make his store more well-known, which will allow him to make a better income and thus be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to fix his car and to buy groceries such as milk.

loans.name: Herlan Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Herlan tiene 30 años y es Soltero con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 7 Años, el tiene un bar y donde se encuentra instalada una rokola, donde le va muy bien, su negocio s encuentra en la zona de  Warnes. Este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, Herlan utilizara este préstamo para la Compra de 1 equipo de gas para transformar su vehículo de gasolina  a gas natural y así reducir sus gastos en combustible, ya que este vehículo es de gran ayuda ya que le permite transportar sus productos a su negocio,  Lucio  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios en Mejorar la calidad de vida, su deseo es el de que su negocio sea el mas conocido en la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Herlan is 30, single, and has a seven-year-old son.  He has a bar where he has installed a jukebox, and the business is going very well. It is located in the Warnes area.
