texts.es: Cinder de 33 años, es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 15 años. Ella tiene un negocio donde vende mercancía variada que distribuye entre sus clientes, mediante el sistema de crédito; ellos están ubicados alrededor de su vivienda en barrios cercanos y en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde tiene familiares que le remiten nuevos clientes. Su experiencia data desde hace 6 años cuando inició su vida como comerciante con pocos productos, pero poco a poco logró nuevos proveedores y así mismo opciones de vender mediante guías especializadas de productos de empresas multinacionales, en las que se  ha vinculado. Últimamente una microempresaria, vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le está vendiendo cubre lechos que elabora, para que Cinder los venda y gane dinero también; ahora tiene muchos pedidos pero debe contar un capital de trabajo disponible,  para lograr responder a su clientela tal como estos lo requieren. Por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada como perfume, ropa interior, fantasía, y cubrelechos. Su meta mas adelante es terminar de adecuar su vivienda, la cual recién la adquirió y continuar creciendo en su negocio, para alcanzar sus sueños de potencializar un futro exitoso a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cinder, 33, is a married woman with three children, who are 12 to 15 years old. She has a business selling a variety of merchandise to customers on credit. Her clients are located close to home in nearby neighborhoods and in the city of Barranquilla, where she has relatives who refer new customers to her.

Cinder began her life as a merchant six years ago with a small inventory, but gradually acquired new products and thereby options of selling through the specialized catalogs of multinational businesses to which she has established ties. Lately, an entrepreneur associated with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been selling her the bedcovers she makes so that Cinder can re-sell them and earn money as well. Now she has many orders for her products but must have available working capital in order to fill her customer’s orders in a timely fashion. Consequently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a variety of merchandise, such as perfume, underwear, costume jewelry and bed covers.

Cinder’s later goal is to finish upgrading her dwelling, which she recently acquired, and to continue expanding her business in order to fulfill her dreams of helping her children attain a successful future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as perfume, underwear, costume jewlry and bedcovers.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
15 señoras  trabajadoras de la ciudad de Caaguazú se unieron para formar un grupo; un comité solidario, en donde el compromiso es conjunto y tienen un espíritu emprendedor. Actualmente están en el 9no. Ciclo y están muy entusiasmadas de seguir progresando.
Marta es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que ellos necesitan para tener un mejor estilo de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, debido a que tiene muy buena variedad que ofrece a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar prendas, las cuales desea para poder surtir con más variedad su negocio. Ella se define como una persona que se esfuerza siempre por lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Fifteen hardworking women from the city of Caaguazú came together to form a group. This is a supportive community bank where the commitment is shared and they have an entrepreneurial spirit. Currently they're in their ninth cycle and they're very excited to continue making progress. 

Marta is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She tells us that due to her work, she has been able to support her family and give them what they need to have a better way of life. 

Marta sells all types of garments, which is going very well for her thanks to the wide variety she offers her customers. She is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing, which she wants in order to stock her business with more variety. She describes herself as a person who always works hard to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 35 years old and married with two children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income, she runs a cafeteria. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow dryer, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa librada es el grupo formado por 21 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son reconocidas en el barrio por la unión con la que trabajan, y es por ello justamente que han podido salir adelante y crecer. Actualmente están en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, y están muy contentas por ello.
Viviana es modista, y comenta que trabaja todos los días en su taller montado en su casa, y cuenta que la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre le dan mucho trabajo, lo que la ayuda a poder mantener su casa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más insumos para hacer sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Santa Librada [Saint Wilgefortis] is a group composed of 21 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city. They are known in the neighborhood through the community bank they work with, and it's precisely because of this that they have been able to get ahead and grow. Currently they're in their third cycle of the women's entrepreneur program at Fundación Paraguaya, and they're very happy with it. 

Viviana is a dressmaker. She says that she works every day in her shop, which is set up in her home. She tells us that the majority of her neighbors always give her a lot of work, which helps her to be able to maintain her home. She is a very hardworking and determined person who wants to keep working to help her family. 

Viviana is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, and elastic, among other things, with which she will be able to stock up and have more materials to do her work.

loans.use: to buy materials for a sewing shop.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old and married to Ann. They live in Nakuru and they have been blessed with two children. He operates a bread supply business in Nakuru. He plans to use this loan to buy more bread to sell to meet the high demand for bread from his clients. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business and distribute bread to all parts of Nakuru .

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Now, Lolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her dried fish business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA. It continues to provide Lolita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 30 years old, married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and equipment.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and equipment.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store.

Marissa has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal “las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II”  ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia  Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos (1 independientes), la señora estudio educación secundaria.
 
La señora se dedica a la venta de comidas como truchadas, hace dos ciclos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramas, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, la que invirtió en su negocio.

En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 1,700.00 nuevo soles dinero que comprará insumos para la preparación de alimentos y mercaderías para su tienda de abarrotes, trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su tienda de abarrotes bien surtido y tener un carro para transportar su mercadería.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II communal bank, located in the district of Arapa, province of Azángaro and department of Puno.  She is 53 years old and married, with two children (one independent).  She studied at the secondary level.

She works selling food such as "truchadas" [a social activity where people come together to raise funds and have a meal; in this case, mainly trout].  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles (PEN), which she invested in her business.

Currently she will request a new loan for the sum of 1,700 PEN, money with which she will buy supplies to make food and merchandise for her grocery store.  She works alone in the business.  Her husband is a teacher. 

Her dream for the future is to have her grocery store well stocked and have a car to transport her merchandise.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food and merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nicat

texts.ru: Nicatu 29 let, on jenat u nego dvoe malenkix detey 2 i 4 let. Sfera ego deyatelnosti yavlayetsa torgovley. On prodayet posudu I raznie tovari. Nicat nachal svoy biznes 5 let nazad. Ego semya jivet v dome iz sirogo kirpicha I on planiruet perestroit noviy dom iz kamna dla togo chtobi ego semya jila v bolee zdorovix usloviyax, poetomu ego cel eto rasshirit sferu torgovli i v budushem postroit svoy sobstvenniy magazin. Nicatu nujni dengi v summe 1000 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit noviy tovar dla prodaji. Nicat ochen trudolubiviy, iskrenniy I zabotliviy semyanin.
texts.en: Nicat is 29 years old, he is married and has two small children who are two and four years old. He is in the retail business. He sells dishware and other products. Nicat started his business five years ago. His family lives in a house made of crude brick and he plans to rebuild the home from stone so that his family could live in more healthy conditions. This is why his goal is to expand his retail business and to build his own store in the future. Nicat needs a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy new products for sale. Nicat is very hardworking, sincere and caring family man.

loans.use: to buy new products for sale in order to expand the business and rebuild the house.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.ru: Sfera deyatelnosti Ramila yavlayetsa selskoxozaystvom. Emu 35 let, on jenat I u nego 2 detey. On derjit korov I baran. Vesti delo emu pomogayut ego mat’ I jena. On prodaet moloko, sherst I masyo mestnim jitelam sela gde on jivet. Ramil obratilsa za dengami v 1000 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit baraninu dla otkorma i prodaji. On xochet uvelichit svoi doxodi dla togo chtobi nachat delat remont doma.
texts.en: Ramil's business is agriculture. He is 35 years old, he is married and has two children. He keeps cows and sheep. His wife and mother help him run the business. He sells milk, wool and meat to the local residents in the village where he lives. Ramil has asked for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy sheep for fattening and resale. He wants to increase his income so that he can start to repair his home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 15 de Mayo  está integrado por 11 mujeres, quienes encuentran en el 1 ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar  a sus familias.
Una historia es la de la Sra. Luisa quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, nos comenta que tiene una clientela bien definida, que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende.  Nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró.
 Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, pantalones, y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá trabajar y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 15 de Mayo communal bank is made up of 11 women who are in their first loan cycle, working together and supportively in the program.  In addition to the independent work of each one, they also have group activities.  At the same time, they help each other mutually to realize their objective, which is to work to support their families.

One story is that of Luisa, who works selling clothing.  She tells us she has a well-defined clientele that always buys the clothes she sells.  She tells us that with this business her family finances improved.

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of garments, such as shirts, pants, and other types, with which she will be able to work and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is married. She has four children aged between 7 and 16. She has been a rice farmer since 2004. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de diciembre se encuentra, en su 4º.ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, donde todas las integrantes tienen actividades, y también realizan actividades en conjunto, con lo cual desean fomentar su trabajo en grupo.
 La Sra. Lucia, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica al reciclado y también a la venta de asaditos los fines de semana. Tiene 2 hijos y nos comenta que ellos son su razón de lucha constante. Ella recorre las calles buscando los artículos reciclables para después venderlos. Está muy orgullosa de su trabajo, pues es digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales reciclados en cantidad para después revenderlos, ya que con eso tendrá más ganancia. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre communal bank is in its fourth loan cycle.  We can say that the group is very responsible.  All the members have jobs and they also have group activities to promote working in groups.

Lucia is one of the members.  She works in recycling and also selling grilled meat on the weekend.  She has two children and she tells us that they are the reason for her constant struggle.  She scours the streets looking for recyclable materials to later sell.  She is very proud of her job because it is honorable and honest.

She is requesting the loan to buy recycled materials in bulk to later resell, because she will have more profits.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 46 years old. He lives in a village of Dmanisi District with his family, wife Chavair and their 18 years old daughter. Mubariz works as a bus driver, connecting Dmanisi to a nearby country’s capital city. He gets a monthly salary for his job. Along with his main job, Mubariz in involved in the family agricultural business, which is led by Chavair. They have 2 milk cows, 2 calves, and 6 sheep in the family farm. Chavair produces cheese and sells it on the local market. She also sells lambs. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Mubariz requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. With three cows, Chavair will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese. The income of the family will increase by 150 Laris. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 49, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a driver, and a mother to their five children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Susan's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan dreams to be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to grow her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 26-year-old man from Vihiga town. He is married to Irene and they have a five-year-old child.

Peter operates a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last two years. The shop earns him a monthly income of KES. 8,000. He is now taking a second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy retail stock of sugar, maize flour, and bread. His profits will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of sugar, maize flour, and bread.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Prudencia  tiene 49 años y es soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de canastillas hecha a mano con una planta llamada tokoro, esta producción de canastillas son para floreros tu casa se encuentran en la zona Venancio este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución y la Sra., Prudencia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tokoro) para la fabricación de canastillas, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliación del negocio. Prudencia enfrenta retos en su negocio el trabajo manual tedioso que le toma hacer las canastillas, La Sra. prudencia se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación de crédito ya que esta es su única actividad para mantenerse.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 49 years old and single, with no children.  She works making and selling little baskets made by hand with a plant called "tokoro."  These baskets are for vases in your house.  They are in the Venancio area.

This loan is her first cycle with the institution and Prudencia is going to use it to buy raw materials (tokoro) to make baskets.  The reason for requesting the loan is to expand her business.

Prudencia faces challenges in her business.  The manual work is tedious and takes her time to make the baskets.  Prudencia is very happy about and grateful for the opportunity they are giving her in the offer of a loan because this is her only activity to support herself.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (tokoro plant).

loans.name: Jessica Jessenia

texts.es: Jessica de 30 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ) . ella empeso su negocio po el motivo de que el sueldo de su esposo no le alcansava para sustentar a su familia. Empeso vendiendo almuerzo en su casa  y con esfuerzo saco adelante el negocio. Trabaja todo los días con muchas ganas. A futuro ella desea darle un mejoramiento a su casa y a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( materiales de vivienda) y asi comprar Cemento, arena, bloques para construir mejor su vivienda y mejorar el restaurante.
texts.en: Jessica, 30, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She started her business because her husband's salary was not enough to sustain their family. She started selling lunch from her house and through her efforts, she has developed her business. She works every day and looks forward to it. In the future she hopes to make improvements to her house, for her children's sake. She will use this loan to buy housing materials -- cement, sand, and concrete blocks -- to better construct her home and to improve her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and concrete blocks

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is single. He has been a rice farmer for 7 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor, in order to get the best harvest he can. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. He also wants to create a savings plan.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is married with one 3-year-old child. She has been a rice farmer for the past seven years. She would like to get this Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor, in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, Domitille plans to expand the area she has been using to get more crop output. She also wants to make a savings plan.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor costs.

loans.name: Darlen Emilson

texts.es:
Emilson tiene 22  años de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y en algunas ocasiones le ayuda a su esposo a cumplir con algunos trabajos en la finca. Emilson se dedica al cultivo de café y aprendió del oficio gracias a su padre. 
El negocio del cultivo de café  en ciertas temporadas resulta ser muy rentable para Emilson ya que cuenta con buenos clientes y le dan un buen precio por el café. El solicita este préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de la finca para poder obtener una buena cosecha. El préstamo le ayudaría en gran manera ya que anteriormente tenía que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios los cuales se aprovechan a pagar el café a un bajo precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta Emilson es la escasa mano de obra para cosechar el café y las dificultades que tiene para trasladar el producto ya que la cosecha es para temporada de invierno las calles se ponen en muy mal estado. El mayor deseo de Emilson es mejorar la instalación física de su finca para aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en: Emilson is 22, married, his wife is a homemaker and sometimes helps him with work at the ranch.  Emilson works growing coffee, he learned this business from his father.  The business of coffee growing in certain seasons is very profitable for Emilson because he has good clients that offer good prices for the coffee.  He requests a loan to buy fertilizer because he needs it to improve the plantation so he can have a good harvest.  The loan would help him in a big way because previously he had to commit the harvest through intermediaries who take advantage of paying the coffee at a lower price.  Some of the problems that Emilson faces are the shortage of labour to harvest coffee and the difficulties that he has to transport the product because harvest season happens in winter and the streets are in bad shape.  Emilson's biggest dream is to improve hi ranch infrastructure so he can increase his earnings and improve the economy of his home.   This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to be punctual with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee plantation.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 52-year-old married man with 3 children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For 10 years, Mohamed has operated a fish selling business, selling his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbours. Mohamed has another source of income which is a grocery business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be a lack of storage. His highest monthly expense is food. Mohamed will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a freezer to store fish. 

Mohamed aspires to establish a fish selling stall in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer to store fish for sale.

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and a brother). Eseri has a retail food stall selling bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes at the market. She has been in this business for the last 7 years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Eseri has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, bags of cassava, and sweet potatoes. 

Eseri's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with transportation and  to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house. The family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, bags of cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married; she is a mother of six children aged between 5 and 14. She has been a rice farmer for seven years. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using in order to get more output and to rear cattle in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Halfan

texts.en:
Halfan is a 44-year-old married man  with 3 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past 6 years, Halfan has operated a grocery and a fish selling business, selling his goods from home. He also sells fried fish. His primary customers are neighbours. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation, and his highest monthly expense is food. 

Halfan will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of onions, tomatoes, and fruit to sell. Halfan aspires to establish a selling stall in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, tomatoes, and fruit for sale.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
This is Jenita, 33. She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a foam maker, and is a mother to her two children; both children are in elementary school. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining their daily expenses.

Jenita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also helps her husband in selling foams as an additional daily income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items and stock. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her earnings will be a big help for the education of her children.   

Jenita dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow and help them maintain daily expenses. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it makes her a better person and strengthens her faith in Christ.  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be social and friendly. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, onions and kale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery store.

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more potatoes and cabbages. Her business goal is to be selling tomatoes and potatoes on a wholesale basis within five years. Gladys hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Margelis

texts.es: Margelis de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad. En su barrio todos conocen que ella tiene un negocio de venta de mercancías variadas, otro de preparación y venta de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, o congelados,  como deditos, empanaditas y otro de venta de leche. Su clientela no se preocupa de los detalles que regalará,  en fechas especiales a amigos y familiares, porque sabe  que Margelis siempre consigue lo que ellos necesitan,  a un buen precio  y  que fácilmente pueden pagarlo en cuotas. Ella es una mujer muy servicial y por eso es muy conocida. Por eso cuando inició su negocio lo hizo con mercancía que le suministraba una amiga, en la medida en que fue conociendo nuevos proveedores, empezó a tener independencia en la compra y aumento su oferta, volviéndola  mas diversificada, logrando así ampliar el número de compradores que poco a poco fue fidelizando y hoy forman parte de su base de clientes, que le refieren nuevos. Su propósito de tener un almacén de variedades en su propia casa, la lleva a buscar estrategias para aumentar su capital de trabajo y este es su mayor desafío, por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará lociones, mercancías, cosméticos y también alimentos congelados, pues tiene un gran mercado al que responderle con este tipo de productos y esto hace que su inversión tenga potencial de éxito, también apuntándole a que su rentabilidad sobre las ventas, es no menor a un 43%,  indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en:
Margelis, 27, lives in Cartagena with her spouse and her son, who is 6 years old. In her neighborhood, everyone knows that she has a business selling varied merchandise and another where she prepares and sells bread products, frozen snacks, cookies, empanadas and milk. Her customers don't worry about what they will give as presents for special occasions to friends and family, because they know that Margelis is always able to get what they need, at a good price and they can pay in installments, which is easier for them. 

She is well known for being a helpful woman. Because of this, she was able to start her business with merchandise supplied by a friend. As she got to know new suppliers, she started to become more independent in her purchases and increased her merchandise, making it more diversified. She was able to increase the number of customers and earn their loyalty, little by little. Today, they form her client base and refer new customers to her. Her goal of having a corner market in her own home, makes her look for strategies to increase her capital. This is her greatest challenge and why she has requested a Kiva credit, which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will buy lotions, cosmetics, frozen snacks and other merchandise. She has a great market to sell these products to and makes the success of her investment more likely. Also noting that her profitability over sales is no less than 43%, a financial indicator that she uses to predict future growth.

loans.use: buy lotions, cosmetics, frozen snacks and other merchandise.

loans.name: Esperanza Josefina

texts.es: Esperanza de 57 años vive ( machala ecuador) ella empeso este negocio hace 2 años de vender ropa por catalogo y Yambal porque una amiga la motivo a hacerlo y a incribirse. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo todos los días apartir del medio dia. A futuro ella desea ser directora de Yambal y que su neocio de ropa pueda crecer. Con en préstamo comprara (Yambal y ropa por catalogo) persumes, cremas.
texts.en: Esperanza, 57 years old, lives in Machala, Ecuador. She started this business two years ago, selling catalog clothing, Yanbal, because her friend convinced her to sign up. She works very hard every day, starting at noon. In the future, should would like to be a director at Yanbal and would like her clothing business to grow. With the loan, she will purchase Yanbal and other catalog clothing, perfumes and lotions.

loans.use: purchase mail order clothing, perfumes and creams

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Suerte lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lissette de 27 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y trabaja en belleza de manera a domicilio hace 8 años y su meta es poner un salón en su casa. Ella es casada y tiene una niña de 12 años.
Las otras integrantes son María quien vende frescos en especial pinolillo, tiste, pinol y tiene una tapicería y Sadia tiene una tortillería.
texts.en: The group, la Suerte (Luck), is formed by three hard working and enterprising people. One of them, Lissette, 27 years old, sells cosmetics and has provided mobile beauty services for eight years. Her goals is to have a salon in her home. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter. The other group members are Maria, who sells drinks, especially pinolillo, tiste and pinol and she also has an upholstery business. Sadia has her own tortilla business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Vergilita Group

texts.en:
Vergilita is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with 6 children.
 
Vergilita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 30 years. Vergilita requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Vergilita is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: La Lucha Sigue Group

texts.es:
El grupo la lucha sigue lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Fatima de 33 años quien vende producto Avon desde hace 4 años. Ella es casada y tiene dos niños de 9 y 5 años de edad respectivamente y su meta es a gran dar el local 
Las otras integrantes son Raquel quien vende perfumes, cosméticos y ropa desde hace 6 años y Rosalba quien vende tortilla, queso y plátano.
texts.en: The group, La lucha sigue (The Struggle Continues), is formed by three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them, Fatima, 33 years old, has been selling Avon products for four years. She is married and has two children, 9 and 5 years old. Her goal is to make her business bigger. The other group members are Raquel, who has been selling perfumes, cosmetics and clothing for six years and Rosalba, who sells tortillas, cheese and bananas.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenza Paula

texts.es: Lorenza de 53 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil) . ella a raíz de que su esposo murió decidio seguir el negocio de los celulares y dejar a cargo de su tienda a su hija pero ella no la supo abministrar asi que decidio tomar las riendas de su tienda . trabaja todos los días con ganas. A futuro ella desea aumentar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara ( alimentos) como Enlatados, bebidas, granos.
texts.en: Lorenza, 53 years old, lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador. Since her husband died, she had decided to continue his cell phone business and had left her daughter in charge of her general store. Her daughter didn't know how to run the store so she took the reins of her store back. She works very hard every day. She wishes to increase her business in the future. With the loan, she will buy food such as canned goods, drinks and grains.

loans.use: purchase canned goods, drinks and grains.

loans.name: Luneta's Group

texts.en:
Luneta is married with one child. She is 42 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Luneta is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more fertilizers for her farm. 

Luneta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Luneta hopes to acquire another parcel of land. Luneta is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Kiyal

texts.ru: Кыял 36 лет,  воспитывает двух детей.   В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Кыял начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами со стартовой суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Кыял сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Кыял  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Кыял  планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для ремонта дома, и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Kiyal is 36 years old, she is raising two children. While looking for a source of income for her family Kiyal started her business in 2004 selling vegetables with a starting capital of 2,000 som (KGS). Through persistence and hard work Kiyal was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Today the assortment of goods is not in excess and this is the reason why Kiyal has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 35,000 KGS. She plans to partially invest the income from the loan into purchasing building materials to repair her home and partially into growing of her business.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Lucia Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 27 años y es casada con 1 hijo de la edad de cuatro años, se dedica  a la  venta de leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la zona de Coqueni, es cliente antigua  de la institución,  Lucia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos,  Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas lecheras.
texts.en: Lucia is 27 years old and is married with a four-year-old son. She sells milk, since she has cattle. She lives in the Coqueni area and is a long-standing client of the institution. Lucia will use this loan to buy feed for her livestock. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she doesn't have money and she needs to feed her livestock well so that they will provide her with a good amount of milk and that way she will improve her income. Lucia confronts challenges in her business, such as the feed that she needs to buy every so often, and she will use the profits to improve her livestock. She dreams of buying more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Mujeres En Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank Mujeres en Prosperidad (Women in Prosperity) was formed three years ago in Tecpán Chimaltenango, a village in the central highlands of Guatemala near where the first capital of the country was founded. Currently, the Trust Bank has nine hard-working women who strive to move forward with their lives every day. The women engage in a variety of businesses, including selling: cosmetics, jewelry and gifts, typical and non-typical clothing, food, and curtains. 

Maria Coralia is a member and founder of the Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank. She is 56 years old, married and has nine children, five of which still depend on her. Coralia, as she is known locally, is named in honor of a person who provided work to her father for several years. In the photo, Coralia is the third woman (from left to right), she is wearing a black blouse with purple flowers. 

Coralia has operated a food vendor business for the past 13 years. She sells small portions of typical Guatemalan food and operates her business from Monday to Saturday. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare everything, and then she goes to the market from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. to sell her products. Her business has slowly grown over the years, and she has been able to help pay for her children's education. While most of her children only completed the sixth grade before they stopped going to school, Coralia is optimistic that at least her younger children will reach high school. 

Coralia is excited to receive a new loan, which she will use to start a new business. She is a very innovative woman and recently traveled to another city (three hours from home) for training in baking and decorations. She now wants to use her newfound knowledge to start a bakery. The loan that she receives will be used for two purposes: to invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, such as a mixer, for baking. 

"Access to loans for women is a great opportunity for growth; it makes us more independent and allows us to make our own decisions," said Coralia. "My dream for my current business as for my new business is that in the future the two of them can be sustainable, so I further support my children's education." 

The Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank is very surprised that people from other countries have the desire to invest in them and are thankful that Kiva lenders reach out and trust them to use the loans wisely.

loans.use: To invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, a mixer, for baking.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 37 anas, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont tous sont scolarises, a l'obtention de son bac n'ayant pas de moyen pour continuer des etudes universitaires, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie et des ustensiles en plastique.
Ayant beneficiee deja de 3 cycles de prêts,ses ventes ont énormément évolue, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables et avec ses benefices elle vient d'ouvrir une boutique de chaussures en plein marche.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des ballots de friperie comme les baskets , des sandales pour homme et enfants, acheter de la peinture pour repeindre et  améliorer ses conditions de vente.
 Elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout en ce qui concerne son commerce et elle a pour ambition de devenir une grande femme d'affaire.
texts.en:
This borrower is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children who all attend school.  After getting her high school degree, she lacked the financial means to go to college, and became involved in the sale of used shoes and plastic utensils.
She has already benefited from three loan cycles, which has had a very positive impact on her sales.  She has successfully repaid her loans and has saved a lot of money.  With her profits, she has just opened a shoe store at the very center of the market.
With this new loan, she will increase her stock of second-hand shoes and buy sneakers and sandals for men and children.  She will also buy some paint to improve the appearance of her store and therefore her working environment.
She is very motivated when it comes to her retail business and her ambition is to become an important business woman.

loans.use: to buy bags of shoes for women and sneakers for men and children.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has been in the dressmaking business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She is 29 years old and single. She plans to use this loan amount to buy clothing material for use in her business. 

In the future , Julia hopes expand her business and open more dressmaking shops in Nakuru.

loans.use: buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Gaudensia is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be social and honest. 

Gaudenia operates a food stall where she sells doughnuts. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Gaudenia will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy food ingredients.  Her  business goal is to expand her food stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, 57, a self-employed man.  Tessie is a mother of two children, both are high school students. While attending to her family, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining their daily expenses. 

Tessie owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Tessie is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items to enable her to have more stocks. The more items are displayed at the store the better, as they help to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit, which will help her to save more money for the expenses of her children in school. 

Tessie hopes that her business will maintain an income that is sufficient for the needs of her family. She dreams that all her children will be able to finish their studies and be able to land a good and stable job someday. She wants to make available additional appliances that they need. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old.  She is married to Mbogo.  Together they have three children.  

Jane sells fruits and has been in the business for the past two years.  This is her first term loan in KADET LTD.  She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member.  She will use this loan amount to purchase more stock of fruits for resale in her business.  She hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien has one child who is two years old.   He is married to a farmer.   He has been a rice farmer since 2004.  He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output as well as make more savings from the profits.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy more fertilizer, seeds and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mariana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada no ha podido tener hijos propios pero tiene dos que crio como que si fueran de ella, uno ya mayor de edad y una chica de 17 años que este año empieza a estudiar en la universidad, ambos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella es maestra jubilada y ahora se dedica a al comercio, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual también vende electrodomésticos y productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y su hija le ayuda en su negocio,  lleva con su negocio más de 12 años.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y ciertos artículos de bazar. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y es la tesorera del mismo, lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que cresca más su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Mariana, who is 63 years old. She is married. She was not able to have children herself but she has raised two as if they were her own. One is now an adult and the other is a 17 year old girl who starts university this year. Both still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a retired teacher and now makes a living in retail. She has a food store in her house where she also sells electrical appliances and general items. She works every day from 7:00 am until 20:00 pm and her daughter helps her in this business. She has had this business for over 12 years.

This loan is to buy staples goods to stock her store and certain other items. She is a founding member of the communal bank and is its treasurer. She has been part of this communal bank for ten loan cycles and she likes it because the loan have helped her a lot.

Her dreams are to continue working and for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy staples goods and items for her store.

loans.name: Fidelia Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Fidelia tiene 47 años y es divorciada con un hijo que tiene 24 años, la señora tiene su puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de la zona, la Sra. Fidelia utilizara este préstamo para comprar mercadería abarrotes por mayor como fideo y arroz en cantidad y tenerlo almacenada  por estas épocas ya que esta subiendo  invertirá también en el mejoramiento de su puesto, Fidelia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, pero ella es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que vende muy bien y por esta  razón desea acumular mas mercadería para no dejar su puesto y tener que cerrar por comprar y utilizara los beneficios para  comprar mas mercadería, y así surtir su puesto de venta, Fidelia es una persona muy conocida y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 47 years old. She is divorced and has a 24 year old son. She has a grocery stall in the local market. Fidelia will use this loan to buy wholesale products such as noodles and rice in large quantities and have it stored for when its cost increases. She will also invest in improving her stall.

Fidelia faces challenges in her business such as competition, but she is known by her customers as a good seller and for this reason she wants to accumulate more supplies so as to not leave her stall and have to close in order to go and buy. She will use the profits gained to buy more supplies and stock her stall. Fidelia is a well known person who is hard working and she appreciates the helped provided by the MFI.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries for her stall.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 38 years old and married to Peris. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town for three years now.  Besides the motorcycle business, he also has a dairy shop. 

Raymond plans to use this loan amount to expand his dairy shop business by buying more stock of milk for sale.   In the future, Raymond hopes to open other businesses and become one of the leading businessmen in the region.

loans.use: buy milk

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is single. He has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay labor costs to get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and make savings for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers, seeds and pay labor costs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old.  She is married to her 54-year-old husband and together they have five children.  She owns a chemist shop and has been in the business for the past eight years.

This is Alice's first  loan in KADET LTD.  She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member.  She will use this loan amount to purchase medicine to stock in her business.  She hopes to open a clinic in the area soon.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: El Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el camino lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Martha Ruth de 47 años de edad la cual se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años. Ella tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores e independientes. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería en ropa camisas, pantalones, shores, camisolas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Fátima de 32 años vende nacatamales desde hace 4 años y Maribel quien compra y venta de envases desde hace 16 años.
texts.en:
'El Camino' group is formed by three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Martha Ruth. She is 47 years old and she has made a living selling clothes for the past three years. She has four children, all of whom are adults and independent. She will invest this loan in buying stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.

The other members of the group are Fátima, who is 32 years old and for the past 4 years has sold "nacatamales" and Maribel, who for the past 16 years has made a living buying and selling packaging.

loans.use: to buy stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.

loans.name: Nieve Moncerrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nieve, tiene 53 años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y enviudo, pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.
 
Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local hasta donde llegan sus clientes  a ver cuando trae nueva mercadería, la cual la comprar en Guayaquil. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, tiene este negocio  por 15 años y gracias a él ha sacado adelante  a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años  y le gusta porque el grupo que es muy unido.
 
Su sueño  es tener un almacén donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Nieve, who is 53 years old. Her husband died several years ago and left her a widow but from this relationship she had three children, all of whom are now adults.

In order to get ahead in life she makes a living selling all types of clothes. She sells both from door to door and in her house where she has a small shop where her customers come when she has new stock, which she buys in Guayaquil. She works every day in the mornings, leaves the items with her customers on credit and collects her payment every fifteen days. She has had this business for the past 15 years and thanks to it she has helped her family get ahead.

This loan is to buy more stock such as: trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes. She has been member of the communal bank for more than two years she likes it because the group is very united.

Her dream is to have a storeroom where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, trésorière du groupe d’affaire «Zamiri », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 30  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari fait de petits métiers. Elle est  vendeuse de friperie. Il y a  5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  20eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  1 ballon de friperies.  Ce dernier temps, cette cliente a constaté ses ventes baissées suite à la crise économique. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir, les faire scolariser et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is the treasurer of the ZAMIRI group.  She is a 30-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of six young children who all attend school.  Her husband works odd jobs. 
 
She sells used clothes.  She has been involved in this type of small income-generating activities for over 5 years.

She has just received her 20th loan from Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to purchase one bag of bulk used clothing.

Lately, she has noticed a slump in her sales because of the economic crisis.  She would like to see her children grow and continue to attend school.  She would also like to expand her business.  

She thanks Hekima for its action in favor of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy one bag of bulk used clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Johana María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 30  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  un hijo de 12 años de edad que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.  Tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza diversos tipos de trabajo como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende ropa de todo tipo en su local ya que allí tiene unas vitrinas para mostrar sus prendas, las mismas que les da a sus clientes a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días,  lleva con su salón de belleza  más de 17 años y le ha ido muy bien.
  
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y ropa de todo tipo para sus ventas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque  el banco le ha ayudado para aumentar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Johana who is 30 years old. She is married and from this relationship has a 12 year old son who studies at school. Her husband is a salesman.

Several years ago she took a beauty course at a local academy. She has a beauty salon where she carries out various types of work such as: hair dying, men's haircuts, hair painting and other jobs. She works from 8:00 am until 21:00 pm and sometimes later if her customers need her services. She also sells all sorts of clothes in her place of business as she has glass cabinets where she can display her items of clothing. She sells to her customers on credit and collect the payment every 8 days. She has worked in her beauty salon for more than 17 years and things have gone well for her.

This loan will be used to buy hair dyes, perms and all sorts of clothes to sell. She has been in this communal bank for more than five loan cycles and she likes it because the bank has helped her to increase her business.

Her dreams are to continue progressing and extending her business.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, perms and clothes.

loans.name: Bénida

texts.fr:
Bénida est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un  gestionnaire dans une banque de la place. 
Bénida travaille comme revendeuse de perles depuis 2006. Elle vend dans une boutique à toutes personnes. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Bénida a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des perles pour revendre. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bénida voudrait vendre ses perles à l’étranger. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de perspectives d’avenir pour la famille.
texts.en:
Bénida is a 36-year-old woman.  She is married to a manager who works for a local bank.

Bénida has been working as a bead reseller since 2006.  She sells in a shop.  Her customers come from all walks of life.  Her main challenge is a slump in sales.

She has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy beads for resale.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.

In the coming years, Bénida would like to sell her beads abroad.  She says that her profits will allow her family to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETO est la responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Elle est mariée et mère  de 06 enfants. Le plus âgée a 25ans et le moins âgée a 06ans. 02 de ses enfants vont à l’école  et  elle a 06 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du poisson frit  depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Dassasgo en ville. Ses clients sont ses  voisins et ses clients de tous les jours.

Mme veut  s’acheter  04sachets de poisson pour frire.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité car elle achetait à crédit. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une moto pour facilité son activité.
texts.en: ASSETO is the group leader of the WENDTOIN group. She is married and the mother of 6 children. The eldest is 25 and the youngest 6 years old. 2 of her children go to school, and she has 6 dependents in her household. She has been selling fried fish for 12 years. She makes her purchases in the city in Dassago. Her customers are regulars and they are her neighbours. She wants to buy 4 bags of fish to fry. She uses her profits to strengthen her business, as she buys on credit. She hopes to buy a motorbike to make her work simpler.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of fish for frying

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene 55 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con 3 hijos que son mayores de edad (independientes), ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de el Alto,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Filomena utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su vivienda y así poder vivir cómodamente, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ya que hay muchos lugares donde venden comida por esta zona, pero aun así tiene mas venta, la Sra. Filomena se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Filomena is 55 years old. She is not married but is a single mother with three children who are now adults (independent). She makes a living selling food in her stall which is in a busy city in Alto. This loan is her second cycle with the MFI. Filomena will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a house to be able to live comfortably. Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital. Filomena faces challenges in her business such as competition as there are many places which sells food in the area. However, Filomena has good sales and she feels happy and grateful to the MFI for the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Anacleta y la Sra. Victoria, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya y así decidieron formar el grupo,  son 26 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, pero también hacen actividades juntas.
La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la cría y venta de pollo, y nos cuenta que es muy sacrificado, pues debe de estar pendiente siempre de sus animales. Este trabajo le ayuda a poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma mantener a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría y también alimentos para estos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee was created by Anacleta and Victoria, who went to the office of the Fundación Paraguaya, and from there, they decided to form the group. The group has 26 hard working, humble woman who must earn a living each day. They are independent in their work, but they also do some activities together. 

Victoria raises and sells chickens. She says that the work requires much sacrifice because she must be constantly devoted to her animals. This work allows her to continue working and thus support her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase chicks to raise, as well as food for them, which will be a big help for her in her work projects.

loans.use: Purchase chicks to raise and chicken feed for the chicks

loans.name: Grey Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grey, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, los mismos que estudian dos en Universidad y dos en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de sandalias, agua en bidón y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todos sus productos aunque a veces también sale a hacer sus recorridos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sandalias, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.

Here we met Grey. She is 40 years old, married and from this relationship has four children, aged 22, 18, 16 and 12. Two of them study at university and two at school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur. 

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own money makes a living selling sandals, barrels of water and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She has a small space in her house where she sells all her products although sometimes she also travels round to see her customers. She works every day from 8:30 am until 17:00 pm. She has carried out this activity for the past 6 years and things are going well.

She will use this loan to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in this communal bank for the past 6 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras, y de esa forma brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Actualmente se encuentran en en el segundo ciclo, y su meta es poder llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Unice, es una de las integrantes, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas usadas, comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que la venta de ropas usadas tiene muy buena demanda. Ya que siempre tiene muy lindas ropas y gracias a la calidad y buen precio de las mismas, ha podido formarse ya una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá tener mas en stock y de esa forma tener mas clientes. Ellas están contentas por la ayuda que están recibiendo por parte de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Curuguaty met up with the desire to get ahead and support each other and in this way provide a better future for their families. At the moment she is in her second loan cycle and her goal is to be able to get to her maximum level in the program.

Unice is one of the members and she tells us that she makes a living selling all sorts of used clothing. She comments that it is going very well, given that the sales of used clothing has a high demand. As she always has pretty clothes and thanks to the quality and good price of these, she has been able to form a good clientèle.

She requests this loan to buy items of clothing with which she will have more stock and so have more customers. She is very happy for the help they are receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy clothing items for resale.

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants étant tous sur le banc de l'école. Il y'a de cela 3 ans ,elle a commence a vendre  la viande de brousse , les gibiers qu'elle allait acheter dans les villages forestiers  et elle livrait ses produits aux restaurateurs et foyers qui aiment ce genre de mets , son activité a bien marche  et elle a eu a faire des ventes de 50.000 fs a 200.000  frs par jour.

Elle a remboursée ses prêts avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables et en ce qui concerne sa vie familiale, elle nous dit qu'elle a pu améliorer les conditions sociales et a aide son mari pour payer les frais d'écolages et ils sont entrain d'investir pour construire une nouvelle maison.

Avec ses épargnes et son nouveau prêt,elle vient de lancer une nouvelle activité et  elle a ouvert un dépôt de ciment , elle a acheter 5 tonnes de ciments pour un début,et elle continue a gérer les deux activités celui de la vente de la viande de brousse et la vente de ciment simultanément.

Tres fière d'elle , elle veut aller loin dans son commerce et veut être une importatrice de ciment dans les années avenir
texts.en:
The client is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children - all of whom are in school. 3 years ago, she began selling bushmeat and game that she goes to buy in the forest villages, and she then delivers these products to restaurants and households who appreciate this sort of food. This business has worked well and she has generated daily sales of 50,000 to 200,000 frs.
